title: Gerdt Henrik Meyer Bruun
text:
Gerdt Henrik Meyer Bruun (3 February 1873 – 17 April 1945) was a <a href="Norway">Norwegian</a> industrialist and a politician for the <a href="Conservative%20Party%20%28Norway%29">Conservative Party</a>. The son of factory owner Engelbrekt Christen Bruun (1839-1913), he took over his father's business in 1897. He entered politics shortly after this, and served as deputy mayor and later mayor of <a href="%C3%85rstad%20%28municipality%29">Årstad</a> from 1901 to 1915. In 1919, Bruun was elected to the Norwegian <a href="parliament%20of%20Norway">parliament</a> for a three-year period. He was then appointed <a href="Ministry%20of%20Trade%20and%20Industry%20%28Norway%29">Minister of Trade</a> in the <a href="Bahr%20Halvorsen%27s%20First%20Cabinet">cabinet</a> of <a href="Otto%20Bahr%20Halvorsen">Otto Bahr Halvorsen</a>, lasting from 1920 to 1921.
Bruun owned the property "Villa Solhaug" in Leapark at <a href="Minde%2C%20Bergen">Minde</a> until shipowner <a href="Erik%20Grant%20Lea">Erik Grant Lea</a> took over the property in 1915. In 1922 he built Storhaugen at Kirkeveien 62 in <a href="Paradis%2C%20Bergen">Paradise</a> <a href="Bergen">Bergen</a>, after architect <a href="Ole%20Landmarks">Ole Landmarks</a> drawings.
